page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is a coastal area on the East coast of Scotland,approximately three miles from St. Andrews. The land area is undulating deposits of rather sandy boulder clay which gives much rich farmland. It slopes gently to the coast. The shoreline is rocky, except for the mouth of the Kenley Burn. The burn has cut a deep valley into the boulder clay and this is a significant break in the landscape. The valley sides are thickly wooded in contrast to the open landscape of the intensively cultivated surrounding farmland. The only settlement is the small village of Boarhills situated in the South West of the block.
